sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

In the shown quadrilateral RSTU in the figure, it is given that \(RS = RU \). The bisectors of \(\angle SRT \) and \(\angle TRU \) meet the sides \(ST \) and \(TU \) at the points V and W respectively. Then prove that VW is parallel to SU .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle $SRT$ , $RV$ is the bisector of $\angle SRT $. So, we can write}$$
\[
	\frac{SV }{VT } = \frac{RS }{RT }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle TRU , RW is the bisector of $\angle TRU $. So, we can again write}$$
\[
	\frac{UW }{WT } = \frac{RU }{RT }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{UW }{WT } = \frac{RS }{RT }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, from the above two results, we can write
\[
	\frac{SV }{VT } = \frac{UW }{WT }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now in the triangle STU, VW is a straight line such that 
\[
	\frac{SV }{VT } = \frac{UW }{WT }
\]
That means VW divides two sides of triangle STU in the same ratio. Which means that VW is parallel to SU . "}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Since in the triangle $SRT$, $RV$ is the angle bisector of $\angle SRT$, we can use the angle bisector theorem to write: $\frac{SV }{VT } = \frac{RS }{RT }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle TRU, since RW is the angle bisector of $\angle TRU$, we can use the angle bisector theorem to write:}$$
\[
\frac{UW }{WT } = \frac{RU }{RT }
\],$$\text{also, since, $RS = RU$, therefore, $\frac{UW }{WT } = \frac{RS }{RT }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{From the converse of Thale's theorem, we can prove that $VW$ is parallel to $SU$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
